channel.title: Need advice from the Pros
channel.description:
Hello mates,
So, I've recently lost interest in Minecraft and gained interest in the rsps category. But, I would like to start learning to code again and I'm looking for something fresh and GOOD for beginners. I've been told many things. 1.Stay away from AllStar 2.Stay away from Delta. 3.Stay away from PI. So I was wondering, what should I start with, and could someone [u][i]link me [/i][/u]to it as well?
I want to start fresh and not continue my old project because what I wanted to be a learning experience turned into copying and pasting snippets, which I don't want...
Help would be very appreciated.
Kind Regards, Ali Abid
P.S: To all good/decent java programmers, how did you become what you are today?

item.title: Need advice from the Pros
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

AliAbid:

Hyperion also seems pretty complicated…How does one work on the cache? Are there any tutorials lying around for these things?

Working on the cache can’t be so easily done (iirc).

Read full topic

item.title: Need advice from the Pros
item.dc:creator: @AliAbid AliAbid
item.description:
@AliAbid wrote:

Hyperion also seems pretty complicated…How does one work on the cache? Are there any tutorials lying around for these things?

Read full topic

item.title: Need advice from the Pros
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

AliAbid:

Okay, Ill start with Hyperion…Is there something like a client.java or something? I feel so new to this…sorry :o

No. Because it’s more OO than that. There’s no “master” class that does everything. Because it should never be that way.

Read full topic

item.title: Need advice from the Pros
item.dc:creator: @AliAbid AliAbid
item.description:
@AliAbid wrote:

Okay, Ill start with Hyperion…Is there something like a client.java or something? I feel so new to this…sorry :o

Read full topic

item.title: Need advice from the Pros
item.dc:creator: @Dan0194 Dan0194
item.description:
@Dan0194 wrote:

AliAbid:

Also, one more question…Should I begin with a clean delta or pi first? This is just to get some basic knowledge of java and its "compatibility"with rsps, then when I finish, I start on hyperion, when I seem done with it, move on to Apollo, does that seem right?

No no no you don’t start with delta or pi there just filled with bad code. Just start with hyperion or apollo whichever one you find easier for yourself.

Read full topic

item.title: Need advice from the Pros
item.dc:creator: @AliAbid AliAbid
item.description:
@AliAbid wrote:

Also, one more question…Should I begin with a clean delta or pi first? This is just to get some basic knowledge of java and its "compatibility"with rsps, then when I finish, I start on hyperion, when I seem done with it, move on to Apollo, does that seem right?

item.title: Need advice from the Pros
item.dc:creator: @Dan0194 Dan0194
item.description:
@Dan0194 wrote:

[quote=“AliAbid, post:12, topic:545328”]Thanks all for the answers…I’ll look into these sources.

Can anyone also tell me how did they learn java? I just don’t seem to understand some tutorials, I feel like they aren’t connected to rsps as well…idk…[/quote]

Well most rsps sources are written in java so they are very connected. Start with the basics learning variables are and what an object is(this will really help you).

Read full topic

item.title: Need advice from the Pros
item.dc:creator: @whattehp406 whattehp406
item.description:
@whattehp406 wrote:

Apollo is the way to go. Simple as that. It is probably the best server software out there and it even though it may be a bit more complex than PI or Delta it will be worth it in the long run.

Read full topic

item.title: Need advice from the Pros
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

Pro here; Everything you’ve been told is a lie, use Project Insanity.

If you want something that has some content but little to not tutorials/current knowledge on them, try a 400+ revision hyperion (459, 474, 525 etc)

Read full topic

item.title: Need advice from the Pros
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

Don’t use RuneSource; we all know it sucks.
Hyperion or Apollo if you want development to be easier (lots of tutorials out there).

ScapeEmulator (nothing beats it) if you wanna have the best server ever.

Read full topic

item.title: Need advice from the Pros
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

I would rate Apollo less than Hyperion in terms of complexity, Hyperion was a bit everywhere, apollo has good design and is pretty straight forward and to the point, don’t let the mass of files turn you away! It is honestly the best choice you could make if you’re really that motivated to learn!

Hyperion isn’t a good choice either as it has a ton of boiler-plate, outdated network code, it’s more verbose and all over the place than it needs to be and a lot of the design isn’t the greatest.

Don’t use RuneSource to make an actual server, it was created to prove the point that a wL style server can perform well and it proves just that. RuneSource is good for studying NIO and how to use a proactor/reactor design pattern, not much else, imo

Read full topic

item.title: Need advice from the Pros
item.dc:creator: @AliAbid AliAbid
item.description:
@AliAbid wrote:

Thanks all,

Ill take a look at all of these, Hyperion is looking quite easier than Apollo as you both said.

Read full topic

item.title: Need advice from the Pros
item.dc:creator: @Dan0194 Dan0194
item.description:
@Dan0194 wrote:

apollo is probably the best base out there but it’s also the most complex and advanced(but if your up for it go for it). If you want a little easier base try out rune-source or hyperion.

Read full topic

item.title: Need advice from the Pros
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

I would NOT recommend apollo as it’s very advanced.
Try hyperion or rune-source which are both very decent bases as well but are a bit easier for starters like you.

Read full topic

item.title: Need advice from the Pros
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

[quote=“AliAbid, post:3, topic:545328”][quote author=AtomicInt_ link=topic=664209.msg4439997#msg4439997 date=1406257323]
Hi, you seem very motivated. I would suggest working on Apollo as it is arguably the best released base available to us.

Here is a link to the activly developed repository: https://github.com/apollo-rsps/apollo/
[/quote]

Thanks sir,
Is there any recommended client for this?[/quote]

Any unmodified revision #317 client will work.

Read full topic
